record.dc:title: 59RH41 Hampton Farm Site 86RH41, Rhea Co., TN. Burial 86RH26. Burial pit in cross section. Also stratigraphy of site. Top to bottom: Stratum II, St. II (leached zone), St. III (alluvial band), St. IV (old humus), St. V (alluvial band). Intrusive from Stratum II (lower). Sq. 23L2. Direction northwest.
record.wpa:narrative: This burial was deposited in a deep circular pit, sunk from a point near the top of Stratum II (lower). The burial was virtually disintegrated, but careful removal of the pit fill showed outlines pretty definitely indicating that a tightly flexed individual had been interred. No bones were recovered. A heavy rain eroded a bank of earth into the pit before work was completed on the burial, preventing any photos of the burial. A photo of this pit in cross section was made. Half of this pit extended into a square from which Stratum II was not removed.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration on file at the institution.
